item.title: Hyper-V and CentOS
item.description: CentOS is not listed as a supported OS for Microsoft’s Hyper-V but I’ve found it works pretty well. Whenever I install CentOS on Hyper-V I forget the configuration file you have to create to get eth0 working. So here it is. Install CentOS. Add legacy NIC in Hyper-V settings. Create file /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-eth0and input the following with your values of course. Some other commands or config files that might need to be edited.
